column2: SOUTH CAROLINA PERMIT TEST
column4: South Carolina
column6: SC

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. When dust is blowing across the roadway making it difficult to see other vehicles, you should drive slower and turn on your:
column4: emergency flashers.
column6: headlights.
column8: parking lights.

column2: 2. When a hazard is seen ahead, reaction distance:
column4: equals total stopping distance minus perception distance.
column6: is the sum of perception distance and braking distance.
column8: is how far a vehicle will continue to travel, in ideal conditions, before the driver hits the brakes.

column2: 3. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column6: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column8: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column8: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 5. The yield sign is ___ and white, with ___ letters.
column4: yellow; black
column6: red; red
column8: red; white

column2: 6. Which statement about driving and drugs is true?
column4: Even over the counter drugs can impair your driving.
column6: Prescription drugs are safe to use if they don't make you feel drowsy.
column8: Only illegals drugs can impair your driving.

column2: 7. If driving in foggy weather, drivers should turn on their high-beams to increase the field of vision.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 8. The proper braking method involves:
column4: using your right foot for both braking and accelerating your vehicle.
column6: always braking hard to reduce your stopping distance.
column8: always braking with your left foot.

column2: 9. This road sign indicates that:
column4: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column6: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 10. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.

column2: 11. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column6: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
column8: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.

column2: 12. If you park facing uphill where there is NO curb, you should set the parking brake and:
column4: turn the wheels toward the curb.
column6: leave the wheels straight.
column8: turn the wheels toward the edge of the road.

column2: 13. To steer properly:
column4: place both hands on the outside of the steering wheel on opposite sides.
column6: use a firm but gentle grip on the steering wheel using your fingers.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 14. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.
column6: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column8: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column4: Merge right
column6: Stop sign ahead
column8: Reduction in lanes

column2: 16. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column6: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column8: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column8: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.

column2: 18. A U-turn is not permitted:
column4: under any circumstances.
column6: In parking lots and residential areas.
column8: On or near any curve or hill.

column2: 19. If a tire suddenly blows out while you are driving, you should:
column4: pump the brakes rapidly.
column6: slow down gradually and brake lightly.
column8: apply the brakes firmly.

column2: 20. What is the most important rule to remember in any emergency?
column4: Run away.
column6: Call the police.
column8: Do not panic.

column2: 21. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
column4: green; white
column6: yellow; black
column8: white; black

column2: 22. An octagonal sign means that drivers must:
column4: be aware possible hazards ahead.
column6: respect the posted speed limit.
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 23. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column4: less dangerous
column6: larger and deeper
column8: narrower and shorter

column2: 24. Which statement about speed is true?
column4: Driving too slowly on certain highways can be dangerous.
column6: Very few collisions are caused by persons driving too slowly.
column8: Drivers should always drive the speed limit.

column2: 25. What should drivers do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Tie a white cloth on the left door handle.
column6: Shift to a lower gear.
column8: Brake lightly.

column2: 26. To correctly execute a three-point turnabout:
column4: signal, check your mirrors and perform the three-point turnabout.
column6: give your turn signal, then perform the three-point turnabout.
column8: signal, check your mirrors, look over your left shoulder and perform the turnabout when clear.

column2: 27. When a car with bright headlights comes toward you at night, you should:
column4: allow the other driver to pass.
column6: look toward the right edge of your lane.
column8: look toward the left edge of your lane.

column2: 28. When using roundabouts or traffic circles, you should:
column4: slow down as you approach the circle.
column6: yield to any traffic in the circle.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 29. This sign means:
column4: Vehicles may only turn left.
column6: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column8: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 30. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
